intro: Boechera saximontana, commonly known as the Sierra Wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in mountainous regions, often in alpine environments. It produces small, yellow or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is characterized by narrow, grass-like leaves and it is often found in open, sun-exposed areas.
